intro: Bomarea stricta, commonly known as the slender bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences at the tips of its stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Bomarea stricta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is often cultivated in shaded, moist environments.
